items.item: README.json file contains netid and URL to deployed frontend site
Frontend web app is deployed and functional
Single Page Application
At least three views: landing, main, and profile
Site has a consistent look and feel
Layout is responsive, for every view
Landing: Users log in using any     username and password
Landing: Users are appropriately notified of bad (i.e., missing) username or password when logging in
Landing: Logging in takes user to the main view
Landing: Registration fields with validation ala hw1
Main: User status headline and avatar image are shown on main page
Main: ability to update the status headline, e.g., text field and button, headline is not persistant to reload
Main: layout of at least 8 cards
Main: layout is responsive to changing width of browser
Main: User's feed is displayed with newest articles first
Main: each card contains author, timestamp, text, and at least four have images
Main: each card has button to edit and another to comment, buttons perform no action
Main: there exists an area to type a new article
Main: button to publish new article which adds new article to feed, but is not persistent
Main: button to clear new article text area
Main: button to upload an image, opens file picker, but otherwise does not upload image
Main: Search bar filters displayed articles by author and text, but not article id or article date
Main: button or link to profile page
Main: button or link to logout, navigates to landing page
Main: sidebar with at least 3 followed users, each has name, picture, and headline
Main: text field and button to add new follower, adds name to list with arbitrary headline and avatar
Main: each followed user has a button to unfollow, removes follower from list, but is not persistent
Profile: shows the user's current profile values (email, zipcode, dob, display the avatar picture)
Profile: button to upload a new profile picture, opens file picker, but does not perform upload
Profile: update button validates each non-empty input field, date-of-birth is not updatable
Profile: update changes the current values that are displayed
Profile: link back to the main page
